content: before next marker kfb sm k1 sm kfb knit to 1 st before the next marker kfb sm row 5b k1 pm kfb k15 17 19 kfb pm k2 42 46 50 sts k1 pm kfb k15 17 19 kfb pm k2 42 46 50 sts row 7a k1 sm kfb knit to 1 st before next marker kfb sm k1 sm kfb knit to row 7b k1 pm kfb k17 19 21 kfb pm 1 st before the next marker kfb sm k1 pm kfb k17 19 21 kfb pm k2 k2 46 50 54 sts 46 50 54 sts row 9a k1 sm kfb knit to 1 st before next row 9b k1 pm kfb k19 21 23 kfb pm marker kfb sm k1 sm kfb knit to k1 pm kfb k19 21 23 kfb pm k2 1 st before the next marker kfb sm 50 54 58 sts k2 50 54 58 sts row 10 knit removing all markers as you go 2 copyright ©2010 2015 maryjane thompson continue in g st for 8 10 12 row you will now have 9 10 11 g st bumps on each side of your work not counting your cast-on row shape top of foot row 1 rs k29 31 33 ssk…and then turn work don t forget the ssk before you turn row 2 ws s1p pull snug but not really tight p8 p2tog turn work row 3 s1k pull snug but not really tight k8 ssk turn work note you will now be working back and forth on these central sts taking 1 st from each side as you go repeat row 2 & 3 another 6 times 35 39 43 sts repeat row 2 ws once more 34 38 42 sts next rs row s1k pull snug k8 ssk don tturn work knit to end 33 37 41 sts next ws row k11 13 15 p9 p2tog k11 13 15 32 36 40 sts ankle cuff next row knit eyelet row ws k2 yo k2tog x 6 7 8 yo p2tog p2tog yo k2tog yo x 6 7 8 k2 continue in g st for 19 21 23 row or desired length ending with a rs row bind/cast off using your preferredvery stretchy/elastic cast off method note my preferred method for these bootees is elizabeth zimmerman s sewn bind-off using 4/5/5 times length rather than 3 to leave me with a useful yarn end long enough for the back seam 3 copyright ©2010 2015 maryjane thompson make the 2 chunky knitted ties using smaller needles the dpns cast on 3 4 4 sts using dk weight yarn and knit an i-cord of about 45 50 55 cm or 18 20 22 or desired length note if knitting long-ish i-cords doesn t appeal you could use a knitting mill or french knitter to make your cords make twisted cords or use some bias binding instead if you choose to knit with a yarn which has little or no
